    • Uses of RefCostFun in choiceModel

      Fields in choiceModel declared as RefCostFun 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RefCostFun RSUE.omega
      The "threshold" must by definition be 0 for the integrity of the class to be maintained, since it is implemented as and RSUET.
      RefCostFun TMNL.omega
      The upper reference cost function that defines the point of truncation.
      (package private) RefCostFun RSUET.omega
      Reference cost function that determines which routes must be unused
      (package private) RefCostFun RSUET.phi
      Reference cost function that determines which routes must be used

      Constructor and Description
      RSUE(RUM rum, RefCostFun phi) 
      RSUET(RUM rum, RefCostFun phi, RefCostFun omega)
      Only class constructor, since the RSUET requires two reference costs in order to make sense.
      TMNL(RefCostFun refCostFun)
      Only constructor; requires specification of the reference cost function.

      the unrestricted master problem, as opposed to the restricted one, does not assume that all routes in restrictedChoiceSet are used.
